documents.title: norway pm applauds facebook reversal
text: the prime minister of norway has welcomed facebook 's decision to reverse its decision to block a famous image of vietnamese victims of a napalm attack .
erna solberg was given the news while being interviewed by peter hunt on bbc radio 4 's the world tonight programme .
she said `` that 's very good , i 'm a happy prime minister '' and thanked the move for `` popular support in norway and from other countries around the world '' .
`` it shows that using social media can make political change even in social media , '' she added .
she had said earlier that the social media giant 's decision to block the image was `` limiting freedom of speech '' which would negatively impact on the teaching of history .

documents.title: facebook u-turn over 'napalm girl ' photograph
text: facebook says it will allow an iconic photograph of a girl fleeing a napalm attack taken during the vietnam war in 1972 to be used on its platform .
it had previously removed the image , posted by a norwegian writer , on the grounds that it contained nudity .
the move sparked a debate about facebook 's role as an editor .
the editor of norway 's largest newspaper had written an open letter to facebook 's chief mark zuckerberg calling the move `` an abuse of power '' .
the social network said it now wanted to discuss the issue further with publishers .

`` because of its status as an iconic image of historical importance , the value of permitting sharing outweighs the value of protecting the community by removal , so we have decided to reinstate the image on facebook where we are aware it has been removed , '' facebook said in a statement .

documents.title: major us stock markets rockedall down by more than 1 %
text: the dow jones is behind by 1.25 % , the s & p 500 by 1.44 % , and nasdaq by 1.54 % .
if things stay as they are it will be the first time the s & p has lost more than 1 % in two months .

documents.title: the axeman comethzimbabwe culls its civil servants to cut costs
text: zimbabwe to cut 25,000 civil service jobs

documents.title: eu halts dow-dupont merger probe
text: eu antitrust regulators have parked their investigation of dow chemical co and dupont 's proposed merger .
the pause is for the firms to provide more information regarding their mooted $ 130bn deal .
the european commission opened a probe last month , on fears the tie-up may reduce competition in some agri and petrochemical sectors .
`` the commission has stopped the clock in its in-depth investigation into the proposed merger between dow and dupont , '' a spokesman confirmed .

documents.title: more details about the gm recallthe company releases a statement
text: gm is voluntarily recalling approximately 3.64 million 2014-17 model year vehicles in the united states .

the sensing and diagnostic module ( sdm ) in these vehicles , which controls airbag and pretensioners deployment , contains a software defect that may prevent the deployment of frontal airbags and pretensioners in certain rare circumstances when a crash is preceded by a specific event impacting vehicle dynamics .
the recall includes certain :
a ) 2014-2016 model year buick lacrosse and chevrolet ss and spark ev
b ) 2014-2017 model year chevrolet corvette , trax , caprice ppv and silverado 1500 ; buick encore ; and gmc sierra 1500
c ) 2015-2017 model year chevrolet tahoe , suburban and silverado hd ; gmc yukon , yukon xl and sierra hd ; and cadillac escalade and escalade esv
gm will notify customers , and dealers will update the software free of charge .
customers also can look up their vehicle identification number ( vin ) at either nhtsa or gm websites to see if their vehicle is part of the recall .
the cost of the recall is not expected to be material and will be included in gm 's third quarter earnings .

documents.title: ftse closes down
text: the ftse 100 in london has closed down by 81.75 points , or 1.19 % , at 6776.95 .

documents.title: `` volkswagen engineer pleads guilty for his role in conspiracy '' this from the us department of justice
text: james robert liang , a volkswagen engineer , pleaded guilty today for his role in a nearly 10-year conspiracy to defraud u.s. regulators and u.s. volkswagen customers by implementing software specifically designed to cheat u.s. emissions tests in hundreds of thousands of volkswagen clean diesel '' vehicles , the justice department announced today .
liang 's plea agreement provides that he will cooperate with the government in its ongoing investigation .
liang , 62 , of newbury park , california , pleaded guilty today to one count of conspiracy to defraud the united states , to commit wire fraud and to violate the clean air act .
he was indicted under seal on june 1 , 2016 , by a federal grand jury , and the indictment was unsealed today .
the case has been assigned to u.s. district judge sean f. cox of the eastern district of michigan .

documents.title: breakingus charges vw engineer in emissions probe
text: the us justice department says a volkswagen engineer has been charged as part of the criminal probe into the german carmaker 's diesel emissions scandal .
he was appearing in court in detroit on friday and expected to enter into a plea agreement that includes his cooperation with the government in its ongoing investigation .
it would be the first criminal charge in the justice department 's year-long investigation into the company 's rigging of federal air-pollution tests .
the firm has already agreed to spend up to $ 16.bn to address environmental , state and owner claims in the us .

documents.title: all aboard the borders railway
text: more than one million passengers have used the borders railway in scotland since it was officially opened by the queen .
the figure was announced by transport minister humza yousaf and scotrail alliance managing director phil verster at edinburgh 's waverley station .
the first services ran on the route from tweedbank to edinburgh on 6 september last year .
however , the opening ceremony was carried out by the queen three days later .
the date coincided with her becoming britain 's longest-serving monarch .
the popularity of the route has considerably exceeded initial forecasts .

documents.title: some thoughts on the uk trade deficit
text: the fact that we as a country buy more than we sell - also known as a trade deficit - has been a persistent problem in the uk for at least two decades .
but in july it narrowed by £ 1.1bn to £ 4.5bn .
the other data was from manufacturers last week , who said the weak pound had helped stimulate the biggest jump in orders and new business for 20 years .
if that effect were sustained then it could help to achieve something the last government only talked about - the re-balancing of the economy .
first , away from property and financial services and towards manufacturing and engineering - `` making things '' ( remember the `` march of the makers '' - the phrase is four years old and empty ) .
and second , away from our chronic dependence on borrowing and financial services to sustain economic growth .
however , be careful .
as matthew whittaker of the resolution foundation pointed out to me on twitter , finance may be smaller than it was before 2008 , but so is manufacturing .
and the trade deficit narrowed - but by less than most economists had hoped .
a weak pound may have stimulated the economy , but it has not suddenly improved our underlying economic fitness .
like caffeine , it will eventually wear off
author: Andy Verity
BBC Economics correspondent

documents.title: oil prices still down
text: in mid-afternoon trade in london , both brent and nymex crude are trading down by about 1.9 % a barrel on the day .
but both have gained nearly 6 % this week .

documents.title: statement regarding christopher bush , ex-tescoreaction to sfo probe and charge
text: today mr bush has been notified that he is to be charged with allegations of being party to the overstating of profit by tesco .
he is extremely disappointed by this decision .
he is not guilty and from the outset has fully cooperated with both tesco and the sfo in their investigations .
he will vigorously contest these allegations and is confident he will be cleared of any wrong doing .
there will be no further comment on behalf of mr bush at this time

text: the new wall street financial thriller in which all the lead characters are female

documents.title: us fed member points to rate rise
text: a member of the us federal reserve 's policy committee has indicated an interest rate rise soon could be on the way .

eric rosengren , president and chief executive of the federal reserve bank of boston , said : `` if we want to ensure that we remain at full employment , gradual tightening is likely to be appropriate .
he added : `` a reasonable case can be made for continuing to pursue a gradual normalization of monetary policy . ''
recent figures revealed weaker than expected us job creation in august .
there had been speculation that the fed would raise rate this month but economists are now looking towards the end of the year .

documents.title: lidl taps 34-year old to lead uk business
text: lidl has charged the new 34 year-old chief executive of its british operation with the task of `` moving the business forward and securing its ongoing market growth '' .

christian hartnagel , the former head of lidl 's austria business , is replacing ronny gottschlich , 41 , who was with the discount supermarket for 16 years , including the last six as the chief executive of its uk business .
during that time , lidl and its german rival disrupted the british grocery market .
lidl 's total market share now stands at 4.5 % .
lidl said mr hartnagel , who joined the group 13 years ago , will now take charge of `` moving the business forward and securing its ongoing market growth '' .

documents.title: uk shares continue downward trend
text: the ftse 100 lost ground through the morning session and is now down 0.4 % .
distribution and outsourcing group bunzl is the biggest faller - down 3.2 % - after a downgrade by brokers at hsbc .
meanwhile ashtead group , which provides construction equipment , slipped 2.95 % .
oil shares remain weak .
bp is down 0.7 % and shell is down 0.6 % .

documents.title: a quiet day for retail ?
text: business correspondent , joe lynam tweets :
and on a quiet day for retail news : lidl uk boss gone , john lewis boss goes political and 3 ex tesco bosses before the courts soon

documents.title: lidl 's uk boss steps down
text: the chief executive of lidl 's uk business has stepped down .
ronny gottschlich has been replaced by christian hartnagel who becomes the chief executive with immediate effect .

mr gottschlich oversaw the german budget supermarket 's rapid expansion across the country which saw lidl and dicount rival aldi steal market share from the big four stores - tesco , sainsbury 's , asda and morrisons .
last year , mr gottschlich was awarded a 56 % increase in salary to £ 970,000 .

documents.title: tesco responds to sfo charges
text: tesco , the country 's largest supermarket chain , responded to the serious fraud office 's decision to charge three former employees in relation to mis-reporting results in 2014 .
it said : `` we note the decision of the sfo to bring a prosecution against former colleagues in relation to historic issues and acknowledge the investigation into the company is ongoing .
tesco continues to cooperate with the sfo 's investigation .
`` the last two years have seen an extensive programme of change at tesco , but given this is an ongoing legal matter , we are unable to provide any further comment at this time . ''

documents.title: sfo charges three with fraud over tesco probe
text: the serious fraud office has charged three former senior managers at tesco in an investigation over the retailer 's mis-reporting of results .
carl rogberg , 49 , christopher bush , 50 , and john scouler , 48 , have been charged with one count of fraud by abuse of position and one count of false accounting .
the charges relate to activity between february 2014 and september 2014 .
the three men are due to appear at westminster magistrates ' court later this month .
the sfo said that the investigation into tesco is `` ongoing '' .

documents.title: crude oil falls
text: after a 4 % jump on thursday , north sea brent crude has fallen back 1.4 % today , to trade at $ 49.27 per barrel .
even after today 's fall , oil prices are still having a strong week , up 5 % .
that 's taken its toll on oil companies .
bp and royal dutch shell shares are down 0.6 % .
on the ftse 250 tullow oil is down 3 % .
oil prices rose on thursday after data showed a surprisingly big fall in reserves of us oil .

documents.title: samsung response to faa warning
text: samsung has responded to the order by the us aviation regulator that its galaxy note7 smartphone should not be charged or turned on during flights .
the phone is being recalled after some phones caught fire .
this is what samsung had to say :
`` we are aware of the federal aviation administration 's statement about the galaxy note7 .
consumer safety and peace of mind are our top priority .
we plan to expedite new shipments of galaxy note7 starting from this week in order to alleviate any safety concerns and reduce any inconvenience for our customers .
we encourage all note7 owners to participate in our us product exchange program .
information about how to participate can be found at www.samsung.com/us/note7exchange . ''

documents.title: john lewis boss to run for mayor of west midlands
text: andy street , the managing director of john lewis , is to run for the office of the mayor of the west midlands .
the conservative party still needs to select him as candidate .
if he wins that nomination , mr street would ( obviously ) step down as john lewis md .

documents.title: sports direct shares jump on 'constructive talks '
text: a major investment group has confirmed that it held `` constructive talks '' with the board of sports direct .

phineas glover , senior adviser to the investor forum , which represents a combined 15 % shareholding in the retailer , said : `` the focus of the meeting was to sort of begin re-building trust between investors and the board . ''
sports direct shares bounced 4.6 % to 335.4p .
sports direct held a stormy annual general meeting on wednesday when a significant number of shareholders voted against the re-appointment of chairman keith hellawell .
mr glover said : `` we 're committed to work with the board .
they 're committed to work with us , particularly over the next three months , which is a crucial period now , we feel , for the company . ''

documents.title: uk jewellery sales to eu hit record
text: jewellery sales helped lift british exports to the eu between june and july .
according to the office for national statistics , sales of jewellery reached a record high of £ 200m .
following britain 's vote in june to leave europe the pound tumbled against the dollar , making it cheaper for tourists to buy goods in the uk .
overall , sales to the eu rose by £ 12.5bn , mainly lifted by oil exports which hit £ 500m in july .

documents.title: facebook censorship claim
text: big moment for facebook 's reputation - norwegian paper slams zuckerberg over censorship of iconic vietnam war photo
@ twitterid that 's what you get hiring.minimim wage moderators with no commonsense or a hinterland

documents.title: export trade boost reveals uk resilience
text: howard archer , the chief uk and european economist at ihs global insight , said that the narrowing trade deficit gap and rising exports in july adds to evidence of the economy 's `` current resilience '' .

he said : `` a major hope for the uk economy going forward is that the substantial overall weakening of the pound since the uk voted to leave the european union in june 's referendum will increasingly feed through to boost foreign demand for uk goods and services . ''
he added : `` while the pound has recently firmed from its post-brexit vote lows , it is still at an extremely competitive level and is likely to remain so for an extended period . ''

documents.title: weaker pound lifts uk trade
text: uk trade deficit narrows on rise in exports thx to a weaker pound
even faster than what was expected i think
as expected

documents.title: uk construction sector slows
text: construction output in july was flat month on month and down 1.5 per cent on the year ( ons )

documents.title: french industrial production slows
text: more bad news from europe .
france , the eu 's second biggest economy , reported a 0.6 % fall in industrial production between june and july .
while that 's a bit better than the 0.7 % decline between may and june , industrial production fell well short of analysts ' forecasts of 0.2 % growth .
french economic growth is slowing .
in the first quarter it reported growth of 0.6 % , and 0.3 % in the second quarter .

documents.title: breakinguk trade deficit narrows on export rise
text: britain 's trade deficit narrowed by £ 1.1bn between june and july after a rise in exports .
the first trade figures since britain voted to leave the eu reveal that the trade deficit narrowed in july to £ 4.5bn from £ 5.6bn in june .
exports rose by £ 800m to £ 24.8bn and imports fell by £ 300m to £ 36.6bn .

documents.title: green rubbishes pension blackmail claim
text: sir philip green has hit back at suggestions that he is attempting to blackmail the pensions regulator over plugging the £ 571m bhs pension deficit .
in a statement , the former owner of the collapsed department store chain , said it was `` wholly untrue '' that he has tried to pressurise the regulator to agree a deal .

the retail tycoon also responded to criticism by frank field , chairman of the work and pensions committee on wednesday that he was unwilling to reach a deal over the pension , calling it `` untrue , totally inaccurate and unhelpful '' .
sir philip said : `` i would like to apologise sincerely to all the bhs people involved in this sorry affair . ''

text: norway 's statoil diversifies into uk offshore wind array ops , increasing stake in huge dogger bank development

documents.title: video : no eu trade deal needed says pub boss
text: the chairman of jd wetherspoon , tim martin , has said that the uk does not need to negotiate a trade deal with the european union.mr wetherspoon , who was a prominent leave campaigner , argues that the uk should trade under existing world trade organisation rules.he was speaking to ben thompson on bbc breakfast .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: german exports fall 10 %
text: german exports slumped 10 % year-on-year fall in july , that 's the steepest fall in almost a year .
imports also fell , down 6.5 % and the country 's trade surplus shrank to €19.5bn in july from €24.8bn last year .
on thursday , the european central bank held interest rates but was criticised for not discussing an extension its huge asset buying programme to guard against brexit aftershocks .
ing economist carsten brzeski , said : `` a further cooling of the economy in the months ahead should give more support to just-started discussions about fiscal stimulus . ''

documents.title: uk shares lower in early trading
text: the ftse 100 has opened with a modest , 0.2 % , loss .
the ftse 250 is down almost 0.4 % .
two pub chains from the ftse 250 are making moves this morning .
jd wetherspoon shares are up more than 4 % after its full year results .
rival greene king is down more than 5 % after it said `` we are alert to a potentially tougher trading environment ahead '' .

documents.title: wetherspoons boss warning over 'scare story two '
text: britain is now facing `` scare story two '' over joining the single market , according to jd wetherspoon 's tim martin .
the chairman of the pubs group , and an outspoken brexiteer , told 5 live that britain making a deal with the european union was `` not a necessity '' , and that they should just be `` friends '' .
on immigration , mr martin described himself as a `` liberal '' and said he had benefitted from employing people from overseas .
`` obviously there is limited reassurance i can personally give [ to staff ] . ''
but he said that during his involvement in the leave campaign , `` not one person '' had advocated sending people back to their home country .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: canned tea anyone ?
text: how would you feel about instant tea sprayed out of a can ?
a company has come up with a liquid concentrated tea , which it says is perfectly brewed and just needs hot water .
`` there has n't been any innovation in tea since the tea bag was created 100 years ago , '' says guy woodall the man behind no more tea bags , on radio 5 live .
mr woodall says the problem is with tea bags is that you have to grind up the tea very small , because tea drinkers do n't brew tea for long enough .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: greene king cautious over brexit impact
text: pub and restaurant operator greene king has reported a 1.7 % rise in like-for-like sales for the 18 weeks to 4 september .
it credited the european football championships and decent weather for what it described as a `` strong start '' to the year .
in contrast to mr martin at wetherspoon , greene king remains cautious about the impact of brexit on the pub business .
as expected , uncertainty surrounding the uk 's future withdrawal from the european union has translated into a softening of some economic indicators and a reduction in consumer confidence .
while the broader implications remain unclear , a number of recent industry surveys have flagged risks to leisure spend and we are alert to a potentially tougher trading environment ahead .

documents.title: wetherspoon profits and sales rise
text: jd wetherspoon reported a 5.4 % rise in sales to £ 1.6bn for the year to 24 july .
pre-tax profits were up 12.5 % at £ 66m , after one-off items .

documents.title: pubs boss gives brexit advice
text: tim martin ( above left ) has used his company 's results to publish his strong feelings about the uk 's vote to leave the european union .
the chairman of pub group jd wetherspoon was a prominent supporter of the leave campaign .
here is his advice to the government .

`` common sense suggests that the worst approach for the uk is to insist on the necessity of a 'deal ' - we do n't need one and the fact that eu countries sell us twice as much as we sell them creates a hugely powerful negotiating position .
if wto tariffs apply , the uk will receive twice as much as it pays .
boris johnson , david davis and liam fox will achieve far more for the uk by copying francis drake and playing bowls in plymouth , rather than hankering after an eu agreement ,

documents.title: honest people are paying for false whiplash claims
text: the association of british insurers ( abi ) is calling on the government to come up with measures to clamp down on fraudulent whiplash claims .
a survey by the insurer aviva found that 76 % of the average premium it collected was spent on claims , with personal injury taking up the chunk of those costs .
in 2015 , 80 % of the motor injury claims aviva received included whiplash , whereas in france , for example , just 3 % of personal injury claims for minor soft tissue injuries were for whiplash .
james dalton , director of general insurance policy at the abi , told bbc 's today programme that soft tissue injuries were incredibly difficult to prove .
he described the industry created around making fraudulent whiplash claims , as a `` racket '' .
mr dalton said changes were needed to stop `` honest '' people from paying for fraud .
aviva said treating minor injuries with rehabilitation instead of cash payouts would stop fraudsters inducing motor accidents .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: three calls for fairer access to mobile airwaves
text: more than 70 % of the radio spectrum used for mobile phone connections is controlled by ee ( owned by bt ) and vodafone .
`` that 's not good for consumers , '' .
says dave dyson , chief executive of rival mobile phone firm , three uk .

he wants the regulator to set rules for the next auction of radio spectrum which will allow four operators to own significant parts of the spectrum , with no individual operator owning more than 30 % .
`` to be competitive in the market you need a fair allocation of the airwaves , '' he argues .
the uk has the most imbalanced allocation of the spectrum of anywhere in the developed world , mr dyson tells wake up to money .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: markets in south korea rattled over nuclear test
text: south korea 's benchmark kospi index was down 1.53 % to 2032.15 points in late trade on friday after north korea said it had successfully carried out its fifth test of a nuclear device .
south korea believes it is the north 's biggest ever test , raising fears the state has made real nuclear advances .
elsewhere , japan 's nikkei 225 was flat , up just 0.14 % to 16,981.01 points .

haruhiko kuroda , bank of japan governor , met with prime minister shinzo abe on friday to discuss financial markets and the boj 's monetary stimulus , however , no statement was released after the meeting .
in china , the benchmark hang seng was in positive territory , up 1.2 % in afternoon trade , while the shanghai composite was flat at 3,096.35 points .

documents.title: china 's inflation slows due to food prices
text: china has posted its weakest inflation numbers since october last year , official statistics showed on friday , due to a softer rise in the price of pork - a chinese staple .
the world 's second-largest economy said consumer price inflation ( cpi ) had slowed to 1.3 % in the year to august , compared to 1.8 % in july , and against forecasts for 1.7 % .
pork prices rose 6.4 % during the month , compared to a rise of just over 16 % in july .
china 's national bureau of statistics said inflation had eased largely because of softer food prices .
china 's official cpi target is 3 % .
some analysts said the weaker inflation numbers in august could prompt further stimulus measures from chinese authorities .

documents.title: hammond promise to bankers over brexit - ft
text: chancellor philip hammond has pledged to maintain free movement of top bankers after the uk leaves the european union , according to the front page of today 's financial times .
the chancellor is responding to pressure from japan and leading banks , the report says .
`` it 's absolutely criticial , '' said james bevan , from ccla investment management on wake up to money .
he argues that over the last 35 years the uk economy had developed a `` vast reliance '' on construction and financial services ( in his opinion that 's why the uk has a productivity problem ) .
if financial services are going to continue to be important , free flow of people is critical , mr bevan argues .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: samsung electronics takes action over hanjin
text: sumsung electronics is seeking a court order to remove goods from stranded ships belonging to the failed hanjin shipping line , according to reuters .
samsung is offering to pay cargo handlers to remove its goods from vessels near us ports .
ports and tub boat operators have been refusing to work for hanjin , for fear of not being paid following the collapse of the firm last week .
hanjin ships are stranded outside ports all over the world .

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to friday 's business live page .
there 's more fallout from the collapse of the hanjin shipping line .
later there are figures on uk trade , plus results from pub chain wetherspoons .
stay with us for a cruise into the weekend .
